*\\n\\nNo records found.\\n\\n\\n+ Add HTTPParam \\n\\nReference materials: Configuring a REST connector (zoominsoftware.io) \\n\\nJSON Transform: \\n\\nJSON transform rule will be used as request JSON tranform for converting object to JSON string (serialization) for forming request to REST Connector. \\n\\nResponse JSON tranform will convert the JSON string received in response to object (deserialization). \\n\\nThe Request JSON Transform and Response Data Transform should be specified on Data Connection rule. \\n\\nSteps to create JSON Transform is available in the attached reference link. \\n\\nBuildAiRequest is the Request JSON Transform and Al Response Model is the Response JSON Transform used in this integration in Civic Sync. As explained above, Request and Response JSON Transforms are used in Data Connection rule to convert object data to JSON string (Request JSON Transform) and for mapping JSON String received in Response to Object Data (Response JSON Transform). \\n\\nReference materials: Creating ISON Transforms (zoominsoftware.io)\",\"title\":\"Integrating with External Services.docx\",\"uri\":\"\"},{\"snippet\":\"\\nIntegrating with External Services \\n\\nConnect REST is one of the integration options available in Launchpad for connecting with external systems. This document outlines the guidelines and procedures for creating and invoking a REST connector from Launchpad. \\n\\nThe following is a list of guidelines typically required to create a REST connector: \\n\\nCreating a Rest Connector \\n\\nFollowing are building blocks of a RESTful API connection: \\n\\nIntegration System \\nData Connection \\nRest Connector \\nJSON Transform \\n\\nThis article explains how to configure and apply each of these rules for establishing a REST connection with external APIs. \\n\\nEndpoint URL\\n Security Credentials\\n\\nData Connection\\n\\nRequest\\nTarget System\\n\\nOptional Settings\\nResponse\\nor API\\n Access Profile\\n\\nCalls the REST service and\\n\\nprocesses the response using JSON transformation\\n\\nJSON Processor\\n\\nConverts JSON data between formats\\n for internal and external systems\\n\\n\\nThis article will detail how to set up an integration with OpenAl in Civic sync, to determine the Permit Category based on the description provided by the user. \\n\\nIntegration System: \\n\\nAn integration system is fundamental to establishing connections between your application and external systems using REST Connect. It defines the endpoint URL for the connection and manages the authentication method to ensure secure communication.\",\"title\":\"Integrating with External Services.docx\",\"uri\":\"\"},{\"snippet\":\"\\nBuildAiRequest is the Request JSON Transform and Al Response Model is the Response JSON Transform mapped in this Data Connection rule for serialization and deserialization, respectively. \\n\\nData Connection \\n\\nGet Permit Category Al \\n\\nGet Permit Category Al \\n\\nGeneral\\nParameters\\nHistory\\n\\nConnection type *\\n\\nREST connector\\n\\nOperation *\\n\\nRead\\n\\nREST Connector *\\n\\nDetermine Permit Category\\n Prompt: BuildAiRequest\\n\\nResponse JSON transform *\\nInput parameters\\n Al Response Model\\n\\nPrompt\\n\\nin\\nBuildAiRequest\\n\\nresource page: casePage\\n\\n\\nReference materials: Configuring a data connection (zoominsoftware.io) \\n\\nRest Connector: \\n\\nTo fully integrate your application with an external system or service, add an outbound REST connector. These connectors are designed to fetch data from designated external sources and handle the responses efficiently. REST connectors enable seamless data exchange, ensuring your application can both request and receive information as needed. This capability is crucial for maintaining real-time communication and synchronization with external systems, thereby enhancing the overall functionality and responsiveness of your application. Retrieve information from an integration system using REST connectors by using either or both the GET or POST method. \\n\\nDetermine Permit Category is the REST Connector rule used in the above mentioned Data Connection Get Permit Category AI.\",\"title\":\"Integrating with External Services.docx\",\"uri\":\"\"},{\"snippet\":\"\\nResponse JSON transform *\\nInput parameters\\n Al Response Model\\n\\nPrompt\\n\\nin\\nBuildAiRequest\\n\\nresource page: casePage\\n\\n\\nReference materials: Configuring a data connection (zoominsoftware.io) \\n\\nRest Connector: \\n\\nTo fully integrate your application with an external system or service, add an outbound REST connector. These connectors are designed to fetch data from designated external sources and handle the responses efficiently. REST connectors enable seamless data exchange, ensuring your application can both request and receive information as needed. This capability is crucial for maintaining real-time communication and synchronization with external systems, thereby enhancing the overall functionality and responsiveness of your application. Retrieve information from an integration system using REST connectors by using either or both the GET or POST method. \\n\\nDetermine Permit Category is the REST Connector rule used in the above mentioned Data Connection Get Permit Category AI. Rest Connector rule holds the integration system rule. \\n\\nREST Connector \\n\\nDetermine Permit Category \\n\\nID DeterminePermitCat \\n\\nDetermine Permit Category \\n\\nService Parameters History \\n\\nIntegration system *\\n\\nAl Model\\n\\nMethod\\n\\nPOST\\n\\nTimeout (milliseconds) *\\n\\n10,000\\n\\nResource path parameters\\n\\nName *\",\"title\":\"Integrating with External Services.docx\",\"uri\":\"\"},{\"snippet\":\"\\nRequest\\nTarget System\\n\\nOptional Settings\\nResponse\\nor API\\n Access Profile\\n\\nCalls the REST service and\\n\\nprocesses the response using JSON transformation\\n\\nJSON Processor\\n\\nConverts JSON data between formats\\n for internal and external systems\\n\\n\\nThis article will detail how to set up an integration with OpenAl in Civic sync, to determine the Permit Category based on the description provided by the user. \\n\\nIntegration System: \\n\\nAn integration system is fundamental to establishing connections between your application and external systems using REST Connect. It defines the endpoint URL for the connection and manages the authentication method to ensure secure communication. This system is the backbone of your integration, ensuring that your application can reliably and securely interact with external resources. \\n\\nAl Model is an integration system used in Civic Sync to connect with OpenAl. This rule consists of the end point url for establishing connection with OpenAl. \\n\\nReference materials: Configuring integration systems using OpenAPI specification files (zoominsoftware.io) \\n\\nData Connection: \\n\\nData connections play a pivotal role in integrating with external systems and services. They utilize either a REST connector or queries to fetch data from a source, which is then passed on for further processing. This document focuses on demonstrating how to use data connections effectively with a REST connector. \\n\\nGet Permit Category Al is a data connection that is used in Civic Sync to connect to OpenAl to retrieve Permit Category. This Data Connection rule is invoked from Get Permit Category automation.\",\"title\":\"Integrating with External Services.docx\",\"uri\":\"\"}]}","inspectionParameters":{"key":"value"},"lazyLoad":false}
